api_key_header.name: Circle-Token
api_key_header.description: Project API tokens are not supported for API v2. Use a personal API token.

basic_auth.description: HTTP basic authentication. The username should be set as the circle-token value, and the password should be left blank. Note that project tokens are currently not supported on API v2.

api_key_query.name: circle-token
api_key_query.description: DEPRECATED - we will remove this option in the future. Project API tokens are not supported for API v2. Use a personal API token.

apiDescription: This describes the resources that make up the CircleCI API v2.
metaDescription:
CircleCI is the software delivery engine for teams who want to ship software faster and with confidence. 
We do this today by building the world's best platform for Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD). Ultimately, we plan to map every source of change for software teams, so they can accelerate innovation and growth. 

Our platform was built by a team of DevOps experts who understand how critical CI/CD is to your entire development process and your entire business. The best software teams know that speed, focus, and consistency of delivery make the difference between good and great. We built CircleCI to deliver on these promises so you can deliver on yours â€” to reliably bring only the highest quality products to your customers.

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

parameters.name: ownerId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the owner of the context. Specify either this or owner-slug.

parameters.name: ownerSlug
parameters.description: A string that represents an organization. Specify either this or owner-id. Cannot be used for accounts.

parameters.name: ownerType
parameters.description: The type of the owner. Defaults to "organization". Accounts are only used as context owners in server.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: A token to retrieve the next page of results.

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: ID of the context (UUID)

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: ID of the context (UUID)

parameters.description: ID of the context (UUID)

methods.description: Get summary metrics and trends for a project across it's workflows and branches

parameters.name: projectSlug
parameters.description: Project slug in the form `vcs-slug/org-name/repo-name`. The `/` characters may be URL-escaped. For projects that use GitLab or GitHub App, use `circleci` as the `vcs-slug`, replace `org-name` with the organization ID (found in Organization Settings), and replace `repo-name` with the project ID (found in Project Settings).

parameters.name: reportingWindow
parameters.description: The time window used to calculate summary metrics. If not provided, defaults to last-90-days

parameters.name: branches
parameters.description: The names of VCS branches to include in branch-level workflow metrics.
parameters.example: A single branch: ?branches=main or for multiple branches: ?branches=main&branches=feature&branches=dev

parameters.name: workflowNames
parameters.description: The names of workflows to include in workflow-level metrics.
parameters.example:
A single workflow name: ?workflow-names=build-test-deploy or
    for multiple workflow names: ?workflow-names=build&workflow-names=test-and-deploy.

parameters.name: projectSlug
parameters.description: Project slug in the form `vcs-slug/org-name/repo-name`. The `/` characters may be URL-escaped. For projects that use GitLab or GitHub App, use `circleci` as the `vcs-slug`, replace `org-name` with the organization ID (found in Organization Settings), and replace `repo-name` with the project ID (found in Project Settings).

parameters.name: workflowName
parameters.description: The name of the workflow.

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: The name of a vcs branch. If not passed we will scope the API call to the default branch.

parameters.name: granularity
parameters.description: The granularity for which to query timeseries data.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Include only executions that started at or after this date. This must be specified if an end-date is provided.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Include only executions that started before this date. This date can be at most 90 days after the start-date.

methods.description: Get summary metrics with trends for the entire org, and for each project.

parameters.name: orgSlug
parameters.description: Org slug in the form `vcs-slug/org-name`. The `/` characters may be URL-escaped.

parameters.name: reportingWindow
parameters.description: The time window used to calculate summary metrics. If not provided, defaults to last-90-days

parameters.name: projectNames
parameters.description: List of project names.
parameters.example: For a single project: ?project-names=some-project or for multiple projects: ?project-names=some-project1&project-names=some-project2

responses.description: Summary metrics with trends for the entire org, and for each project.

methods.description: Retrieves the owner's decision audit logs.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Return decisions matching this decision status.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Return decisions made after this date.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Return decisions made before this date.

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Return decisions made on this branch.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: Return decisions made for this project.

parameters.name: buildNumber
parameters.description: Return decisions made for this build number.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Sets the offset when retrieving the decisions, for paging.

methods.description: Retrieves the owner's decision audit log by given decisionID
Retrieves Policy Bundle for a given decision log ID
Creates policy bundle for the context

repositoryDescription: CircleCI is a top platform for Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, assisting teams in accelerating innovation and growth by ensuring high-quality software delivery. The platform, crafted by DevOps experts, emphasizes speed, focus, and consistent delivery. CircleCI's {language} SDK generated by Konfig (https://konfigthis.com/).
